function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The website currently displays a checkout page for an e-commerce store. This page lists two units of Galaxy S10 5G in the cart with their respective images, names, and prices. The total cost is displayed as $1,821.98. The checkout form is divided into customer information (already filled out), address details (with some fields filled), and payment options (not yet selected). There's also a navigation bar, a cart overlay presenting the same cart summary, and a 'Submit' button for final form submission.","new_testing_goal":"Finalize address details, choose a payment method, and submit the order to evaluate the website's order processing capabilities, verifying successful transition to a confirmation page.","explanation":"Fill in the remaining address fields: State and Zip Code. Then, choose a payment method by selecting between Invoice, Credit Card, or PayPal. Finally, click the 'Submit' button to process the order and look for any confirmation or error messages that might indicate successful or unsuccessful order processing.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"send_keys","element_id":":rv:","keys":"IL"}}

messages.content: Given a web application, you are tasked with assisting in testing its functionality. The emulate_interaction function takes an interaction as input and emulates it on the web application. The return value of the function is the new, filtered HTML source code of the web application. The source code of previous interactions will be omitted from the input to the assistant.
Here are some examples how the 'emulate_interaction' function should be used.
Please test my website: omitted

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description": "The start page of a web site with multiple calculators for different purposes. There are buttons to navigate to the differet calculators and a button to switch the language of the web site. The current language is English.", "new_testing_goal": "Test the calculator for calculating the area of a circle in multiple languages.", "explanation": "First navigate to the calculator for the area of a circle. Then input a radius and calculate the area. Switch the language of the web site and repeat the process.", "interaction": {"interaction_type": "click", "element_id": "btn-area-circle"}}

messages.content: Please test my website. The goal is to test as many different features as possible to find potential bugs, so make sure to include edge cases. Here is the filtered HTML source code of the web application: 'omitted'.

The form is divided into customer information, address details, and payment options. The payment options include Invoice, Credit Card, and PayPal. There's a 'Submit' button at the end of the form.","explanation":"Continue filling out the checkout form by entering the last name, email, and address details. After completing these details, select a payment option and submit the form to test the form validation and submission process.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"send_keys","element_id":":rq:","keys":"Doe"}}

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The web application now shows the checkout page, which includes a detailed cart summary of two 'Galaxy S10 5G' units, and a multi-section checkout form. The form is divided into customer information, address details, and payment options. There's a 'Submit' button at the end of the form. The payment options include Invoice, Credit Card, and PayPal. The navigation bar and a cart overlay are still accessible. The customer’s first name and last name are already filled in.","new_testing_goal":"Continue filling out the checkout form, focusing on the email, address details, and selecting a payment method. Finally, submit the form to test submission and payment processing.","explanation":"Proceed by entering the email in the required field. Continue by entering the address details, including country, street address, city, state, and zip code. Select a payment option and then submit the form by clicking on the 'Submit' button. This process will test the form's submission and the website's handling of payment processing.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"send_keys","element_id":":rr:","keys":"john.doe@example.com"}}

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The checkout page of an e-commerce website, detailing a cart summary with two Galaxy S10 5G units. The page features a form divided into sections for customer information, address details, and payment options, along with a submit button. Options for payment include Invoice, Credit Card, and PayPal. Both the navigation bar and the cart overlay are present, and the customer's first and last name, along with their email, are already filled in.","new_testing_goal":"Complete the address and payment details in the checkout form, verify the form's functionality, including validation of entered details and the final submission process.","explanation":"Proceed to fill out the address details by entering valid information into the respective fields for the country, street address, city, state, and zip code. Afterwards, select a payment option from the available choices. Finalize the checkout by clicking the 'Submit' button to test the form's completion, submission, and the handling of the payment process.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"send_keys","element_id":":rs:","keys":"USA"}}

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The checkout page of an e-commerce website featuring a cart summary with two Galaxy S10 5G units. The form sections include customer information (already filled with first name, last name, and email), address details (country field filled with 'USA'), and payment options (Invoice, Credit Card, PayPal). There's a 'Submit' button for final form submission. Navigation bar and a cart overlay are present, indicating a total cart value.","new_testing_goal":"Complete filling out the address details, select a payment method, and submit the checkout form to test the form validation, submission process, and payment handling.","explanation":"Fill out the remaining address details starting with the street address. After completing the address details, select a payment method (e.g., Credit Card). Lastly, click the 'Submit' button to complete the transaction and test the website's handling of the form submission and payment processing.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"send_keys","element_id":":rt:","keys":"123 Main St"}}

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The web application now fetched shows the checkout page detailed with a shopping cart summary hosting two units of Galaxy S10 5G. The checkout form is segmented into customer information, which is already populated with the name and email, address details with some fields partially filled (Country is 'USA', Street Address is '123 Main St'), and a selection for payment method that hasn't been chosen yet. The rest of the address fields (City, State, Zip Code) are empty, and there's a 'Submit' button for completing the checkout.","new_testing_goal":"Finish filling the address details, select a payment option, validate the functionality of the 'Submit' button, and thereby complete the checkout process to ensure the application properly processes payments and records transactions.","explanation":"First, continue filling out the rest of the address fields with valid data. Select one of the payment options available (Invoice, Credit Card, PayPal). Then, click the 'Submit' button to finalize the checkout process, allowing us to test the entire transaction pathway, from the filling of the form to the validation of entered data and processing of the payment.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"send_keys","element_id":":ru:","keys":"Springfield"}}

The user provided the following end instructions: Please test my website. The goal is to test as many different features as possible to find potential bugs, so make sure to include edge cases.

Pursue your self-assigned sub-goal or assign a new one: Finish filling the address details, select a payment option, validate the functionality of the 'Submit' button, and thereby complete the checkout process to ensure the application properly processes payments and records transactions..

Previously executed interactions by goal: {"Test the 'add to cart' functionality for each product to ensure it updates the cart correctly.": 3, "Test the removal of an item from the cart and the clear cart functionality to ensure they work correctly.": 1, "Test the checkout process to ensure it functions correctly and handles the cart contents as expected.": 1, "Verify the functionality of adjusting the quantity of items in the cart, and testing the checkout process.": 1, "Verify the functionality of removing an item from the cart, clearing the cart, and navigating to different product categories.": 1, "Navigate to the Galaxy S10 product category to test product listings and add-to-cart functionality for each model.": 1, "Test the 'add to cart' functionality for each S10 model and verify the cart updates accordingly.": 1, "Test the cart functionality further by adjusting the quantity of items, then proceed to checkout, and also navigate through different product categories to inspect if product listings update accordingly.": 1, "Navigate to the 'A Series' product category to explore and test product listings within that category.": 1, "Navigate to and test the checkout process to ensure it handles the cart contents correctly and processes transactions as expected.": 1, "Proceed to checkout and test the checkout functionality, including form submission and payment processing if available.": 1, "Complete the checkout form with customer information, address, and payment details, and submit it to test the form validation and submission process.": 2, "Continue filling out the checkout form, focusing on the email, address details, and selecting a payment method. Finally, submit the form to test submission and payment processing.": 1, "Complete the address and payment details in the checkout form, verify the form's functionality, including validation of entered details and the final submission process.": 1, "Complete filling out the address details, select a payment method, and submit the checkout form to test the form validation, submission process, and payment handling.": 1, "Finish filling the address details, select a payment option, validate the functionality of the 'Submit' button, and thereby complete the checkout process to ensure the application properly processes payments and records transactions.": 1}.

Start by describing the website supplied by the function call. Give a short general description first then summarize the main elements on the website. Do not use HTML in your description. Then you may formulate a high level sub-goal to the user's instructions, that should be persued with the next couple of interactions. You should formulate a new sub-goal if the current one has been completed or seems to be unattainable. Give an action plan that explains how the goal should be reached. And finally, describe the interaction to emulate.

Only use the click action with clickable elements. The clickable elements have the following ids: :rl:, :r1:, :r2:, :rm:, :rn:, :ro:. Only use the send_keys action with writable elements. The writable elements have the following ids: :rp:, :rq:, :rr:, :rs:, :rt:, :ru:, :rv:, :r10:. Only use the clear action with clearable elements. The clearable elements have the following ids: :rp:, :rq:, :rr:, :rs:, :rt:, :ru:.

functions.name: emulate_interaction
functions.description: Emulates a user interaction with the web application

page_description.description: A short textual description of the state of the web application: What is the current page? What are the main elements on the page? This description should not contain any HTML.

new_testing_goal.description: Assigns a new high level sub-goal that shall be followed in order to complete the users instructions. This goal should take multiple user interactions to complete. The assistant shall try to complete this goal in the next couple of interactions and then assign a new one.

explanation.description: An action plan that explains how the goal should be reached.

interaction_type.description: The type of interaction to emulate

element_id.description: The id of the element to interact with

interaction_type.description: The type of interaction to emulate

element_id.description: The id of the element to interact with

keys.description: the keys to be sent to the input element

anyOf.description: sends keystrokes to an html element

interaction_type.description: The type of interaction to emulate

element_id.description: The id of the element to interact with

anyOf.description: resets the contents of an html element
